p: Sequencing reads passing quality control are thereafter subjected to virome profiling. Currently, there are two general strategies for virome profiling based on MGS data: (i) reference-based read mapping and (ii) de novo assembly-based profiling (Fig. 3). Both strategies face challenges in the characterization of viral community (Table 2). The reference-based read mapping approach, which is the one broadly used in microbiome studies, is limited by a scarcity of annotated viral genomes [ 114]. However, the enormous viral diversity and viral genetic microdiversity will also complicate de novo assembly of metagenomes [ 115, 116] (Table 2).
